thread.title: Pro golfer sounds off on Tiger Woods: ‘He knows he can’t beat anybody’ | For The Win
thread.title_full: Pro golfer sounds off on Tiger Woods: ‘He knows he can’t beat anybody’ | For The Win

author: Andrew Joseph
title: Pro golfer sounds off on Tiger Woods: ‘He knows he can’t beat anybody’ | For The Win
text:
Follow @andyj0seph 
Tiger Woods’ comeback has been off to a rocky the start. The 14-time major champion dropped out of the Genesis Open and Honda Classic due to back issues. Tiger’s comeback is seriously in doubt . 
One PGA golfer has already given up on Woods. Pat Perez, the world’s No. 67-ranked golfer, said on Thursday that Tiger is done and even Tiger himself knows it. 
Speaking with SiriusXM PGA Tour Radio , Perez ripped Woods and mocked everything from Woods’ injuries to new endorsement deals. 
He said: 
“He knows he can’t beat anybody. He’s got this new corporation that he started, so he has to keep his name relevant to keep the corporation going. So he’s going to show up to a few events, he’s going to try to play … He’s going to show the Monster bag. He’s going to show the TaylorMade driver. He’s gonna get on TV. He’s got the Nike clothes — he’s gotta keep that stuff relevant. 
“But the bottom line is he knows he can’t beat anybody. He knows it. The guy shot 77. That guy can’t shoot 77. What does he do the next day? ‘Ah, my back’s gone.’ He knows he can’t beat anybody.” 
Perez continued: 
“If he doesn’t play Augusta then it’s over. I can tell you that right now … Personally, I don’t think you’ll see him again this year.”
